action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: The image shows a snowy outdoor scene with a yellow fire hydrant in the center. There are dry, leafless branches in the foreground. A dog with thick fur is partially visible on the right side of the image. Trees with no leaves are in the background, and the sky is clear and blue.

DESCRIPTION: A snowy outdoor scene with a yellow fire hydrant in the center. There are dry, leafless branches in the foreground. A dog with thick fur is partially visible on the right side of the image. Trees with no leaves are in the background, and the sky is clear and blue.

This is my DESCRIPTION: The image shows a snowy outdoor scene with a yellow fire hydrant in the center. There are dry, leafless branches in the foreground. A dog with thick fur is partially visible on the right side of the image. Trees with no leaves are in the background, and the sky is clear and blue.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there any visible structure or object in the background other than trees?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A snowy outdoor scene with a yellow fire hydrant in the center. There are dry, leafless branches in the foreground. A dog with thick fur is partially visible on the right side of the image. Trees with no leaves are in the background, and the sky is clear and blue.
QUESTION: Is there any visible structure or object in the background other than trees? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the dog in your image facing towards the fire hydrant?

QUESTION: Is the dog in your image mostly white or light-colored?

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the dog in your image facing away from the fire hydrant?

ANSWER: Yes

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any shadows visible on the snow in your image?

ANSWER: Yes

Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the dog in your image mostly on the right side of the image?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Is the dog in your image mostly on the right side of the image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
